item.title: Dapper Prince Charles is joined by the Duchess of Cornwall as he steps in for his mother the Queen to host a garden party at Buckingham Palace
item.description: Prince Charles, 69, was joined by his wife the Duchess of Cornwall, 70, and sister Princess Anne, 67, for the Buckingham Palace reception honouring hundreds of community leaders.
item.content:encoded:
Prince Charles stepped in for his mother the Queen to host a garden party at Buckingham Palace on Tuesday. 

The royal, 69, was joined by his wife the Duchess of Cornwall, 70, and sister Princess Anne, 67, for the reception honouring hundreds of community leaders.  

The royals looked in excellent spirits as they mingled with guests in the grounds of the palace, with all three stopping to chat with small groups of people.

Supporters stood in crowds four-deep in the hope of catching a glimpse of Charles and jostled for position to take photos as he walked past. 

It is the third garden party hosted at Buckingham Palace so far this summer, with two more scheduled for June and July.

The Queen was on hand to welcome guests to the first two receptions however Prince Charles has long been scheduled to represent his mother at today's event. 

There is one more garden party scheduled to take place at Holyrood Palace next month.  

Charles looked dapper in a grey morning suit, which he wore with a top hat and powder pink tie. 

While it was a sunny afternoon in London, Charles still came prepared with a black umbrella. 

Meanwhile his sister Anne was very much dressed for the sunshine, stepping out in a pair of wrap around shades.   

Over the course of each year, The Queen welcomes over 30,000 guests to spend a relaxed summer afternoon in the beautiful gardens of Buckingham Palace or the Palace of Holyroodhouse. 

The garden parties serve are an important way for The Queen to speak to a broad range of people from all walks of life, all of whom have made a positive impact in their community.

At each Garden Party, around 27,000 cups of tea, 20,000 sandwiches and 20,000 slices of cake are consumed.
item.dc:abstract: Prince Charles, 69, was joined by his wife the Duchess of Cornwall (left together), 70, and sister Princess Anne, 67, for the Buckingham Palace reception honouring hundreds of community leaders. The royals looked in excellent spirits as they mingled with guests in the grounds of the palace (top right), with all three stopping to chat with small groups of people. The invitees were also treated to a march past by the beefeaters (bottom right).
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Linning
item.mi:shortTitle: Prince Charles and Camilla host Buckingham Palace garden party

item.title: M&S sends shoppers into a frenzy with a beauty box containing £135 worth of products for just £15 - and they're already on eBay for six times the price
item.description: M&S has released a summer beauty box with £135 worth of beauty products, including treats by luxury brands such as Origins, Nuxe and Ren when shoppers spend £40.
item.content:encoded:
In December beauty advent calendars containing hundreds of pounds worth of goodies for a fraction of the price had customers queuing around the block outside stores such as Liberty while 100,000 people joined a waiting list for No7's offering.

Now M&S has released a summer offering containing £135 worth of beauty products for just £15. 

Each box contains several full size products, including luxury brands such as Origins, Nuxe and Ren. 

The only catch is that shoppers have to spend £40 in store or online to get their hands on one for a bargain price. 

Some canny shoppers have already put their boxes, containing 15 products and a cosmetics bag up for sale on eBay, in the hope of making a profit.

One hopeful seller has listed theirs at £89 - almost six times the price, although most have been more conservative at £24 to £30.  

If you do get your hands on one it might be worth hanging on to, as the brand's 2017 beauty advent calendars are still up for sale on eBay for up to £130, despite originally costing just £35.   

Eager shoppers have been tweeting their love for the beauty box, with one admitting it makes her feel like she's 'truly living my fancy middle aged woman life'. 

Another said the summer essentials were the best yet from the brand.  

It's not the first time this season M&S has sent customers into a frenzy with a must-have purchase. 

A recent snap of a blue and white striped wrap dress on its fashion Instagram account prompted 5,000 likes and a flurry of requests from customers, even though it hadn't hit the shops yet. 

The post proved so popular that it garnered more likes than a photo shared of Meghan Markle wearing an M&S jumper. 

What's in the M&S Summer Beauty Box?

Autograph Sheer Radiance Eau De Parfum, 30ml 

Formula Ultimate Sleep Cream, 15ml

Color WOW Dream Coat Supernatural Hair Spray, 50ml 

Prai Ageless Throat & Décolletage Crème, 15ml 

EOS SPF Lip balm, 7g

This Works Deep Sleep Pillow Spray, 5ml 

Origins GinZing Gel Moisturiser, 30ml 

Percy & Reed Shine & Fragrance Mist, 75ml

Nuxe After-Sun Lotion, 50ml  

Philip Kingsley Coconut Breeze Elasticizer, 40ml

Ultrasun Lip Protection SPF 30, 4.8g

Pur Cosmetics Fully Charged Mascara, 4ml

REN Atlantic Kelp and Magnesium Body Wash, 100ml

M&S Cosmetic Bag

Autograph Lasting Colour Intense Liquid Lipstick, 6ml

Leighton Denny Nail Colour, 12ml 

Autograph Sheer Radiance Eau De Parfum, 30ml

item.title: They must REALLY like the photo! Kate and William send out thank you cards following their wedding anniversary – featuring the SAME 2016 portrait as last year’s notes
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge have sent out thank you cards to well-wishers following their seventh wedding anniversary on April 29.
item.content:encoded:
Those receiving thank you cards from the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge this month might have noticed something rather familiar.

As is custom William and Kate sent thank you notes to everyone who had been kind enough to send their best wishes on their seventh wedding anniversary on April 29.

Fronting the card was a photo of the couple during their India and Bhutan tour in 2016 - exactly the same image the palace used last year. 

In the photo the Duke and Duchess are seen smiling before the camera during their Himalayan trek to Bhutan's Tiger Nest monastery. 

Photos of the card were shared by royal fan Jessica, 22, from Italy on her Instagram account Royal Addicted 2, which boasts over 200,000 followers.

The note on the card, which remains the same for all recipients, reads: 'The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge thank you for the thoughtful message you so kindly sent on the occasion of their 7th wedding anniversary.

'It was really thoughtful of you. Their royal highnesses send you their warmest thanks and very best wishes.' 

Both the image and the message, aside from the year of the anniversary, are identical to last year's thank you cards. 

Last year's card was shared on a regular well-wisher's Instagram account Royal Letters with only difference being the absence of a cream boarder.  

The MailOnline has contacted Kensington Palace for a comment.  

The couple have previously been criticised for sending out identical messages of thanks on every occasion. 

While nobody expects a personalised response, the royal couple can't seem to come up with a different message for each new batch of cards.

Not only do they send the same 'warmest thanks and best wishes' time after time, but the message on their cards is identical to that used by Prince Charles and Camilla.

The faux pas was revealed by an Instagram account Royal Letters, which shows that Kate and William have sent out the same response on no fewer than four separate occasions. 

It seems that the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are still yet to broaden their vernacular as they are still sending their 'warmest thanks' and 'best wishes'.
item.dc:abstract: The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge have sent out thank you cards to well-wishers following their seventh wedding anniversary on April 29. The couple's card is fronted by a portrait of them on a trek in Bhutan back in 2016. Kate and William chose exactly the same portrait for their sixth wedding anniversary cards in 2017. They also used an identical greeting inside the card to the one they used a year ago.
item.dc:creator: Martha Cliff
item.mi:shortTitle: Kate and William send out thank you cards following their anniversary

item.title: A royally fashionable get together! Spain’s Queen Letizia and her Belgian counterpart Mathilde put on a VERY stylish display at a conference in Brussels
item.description: Queen Letizia of Spain put on a stylish display as she joined Queen Mathilde of Belgium at the opening ceremony of the European Development Days in Brussels on Tuesday.
item.content:encoded:
As queen consorts of their respective countries, they are both known for their impeccable royal wardrobes.

And Queen Letizia of Spain certainly didn't disappoint as she joined Queen Mathilde of Belgium at the opening ceremony of the European Development Days in Brussels on Tuesday.

The annual event brings together members of the development community from around the world, with this year's installment focusing on empowering women in leadership positions.

Letizia, 45, put on a typically stylish display in a red ensemble, while Mathilde, also 45, opted for pale pastel colours as they posed for pictures together.

Scroll down for video 

Letizia showed off her slim silhouette in a scarlet-coloured trouser suit, making the most of her endless legs and toned waist.

The royal teamed the two-piece with matching red pumps and a clutch bag, completing her look with crimson lipstick and coordinating ruby earrings.

Wearing her hair in a relaxed centre parting, she chatted happily with Mathilde along with Rwandan President Paul Kagame and European Commission President Jean-Claude Juncker.

Meanwhile Mathilde opted for more neutral colours, teaming a champagne-pink skirt embellished with leopard print with a semi-sheer high neck chiffon blouse.

The Belgian royal, who recently returned from a tour to the Netherlands, coordinated it with matching nude pumps and wore her hair in loose waves.

She was joined by the EU Commissioner for International Cooperation and Development Neven Mimica as they posed for photographers. 

Later, both Queen Letizia and Queen Mathilde took to the stage to deliver a speech at the opening ceremony for the European Development Days.

The organisation focuses on a number of charity projects, and this year one of their campaigns aims to focus on promoting a safer, more inclusive and open world for women.

Queen Mathilde has been married to King Phillipe of Belgium for 19 years, who ascended the throne following the abdication of his father, King Albert II, on 21 July 2013. 

They are parents to Princess Elisabeth, 16, Prince Gabriel, 14, Prince Emmanuel, 12, Princess Eleonore, 10. 

Queen Letizia is mother to Princesses Leonor, 12, and Sofia, 10, with husband King Felipe, 50, who ascended to the Spanish throne in 2014.

Over the years Letizia, a former newsreader, has worked hard to promote causes she is passionate about.

These include education, innovation, rare diseases, and particularly in nutrition, working closely with the UN’s World Health and Food and Agriculture Organisations.
item.dc:abstract: Queen Letizia of Spain put on a stylish display as she joined Queen Mathilde of Belgium at the opening ceremony of the European Development Days in Brussels on Tuesday. Letizia, 45, put on a chic display in a red ensemble, while Mathilde, also 45, opted for a softer display as they posed for pictures together at the event (seen left and right).
item.dc:creator: Unity Blott

item.title: 'It gave me saucy dreams!' Versailles viewers are left hot under the collar as the raunchiest series yet of the BBC2 drama serves up some VERY steamy scenes
item.description: Who needs Love Island? The latest series of Versailles aired on BBC2 last night and left plenty of those watching it blushing with its candle-lit regal romps in the court of Louis XIV.
item.content:encoded:
While the new series of ITV2's Love Island drew the lion's share of last night's television audience, the antics of Louis XIV in racy period drama Versailles on BBC2 made the modern dating game look positively tame by comparison.

The first episode of the third series of the big budget period drama - dubbed the raunchiest yet - left viewers more than a little hot under the collar with lashings of tousled hair, clandestine meetings and regal romps. 

Those watching were warned as the show aired at 9pm that there would be 'explicit scenes' and while some viewers clearly know the show has form when it comes to steamy encounters, others were left wide-eyed at the X-rated material that followed.

Scroll down for video 

The latest series sees King Louis XIV, played by George Blagden, start up a fiery romance with Madame de Maintenon (Catherine Walker) who shares his desire for power and domination over all.

Viewers watched last night as the pair enjoyed a passionate encounter, before the Queen was also seen locked in a racy embrace with a male visitor to Versailles.    

The language was fruity enough too, with the king uttering at one point about his potential lover: 'Her a*** is tight enough to uncork a wine bottle.' 

On Twitter, there was tittering aplenty at the double offering of sauciness.

 @angelathompson5 wrote: 'Here we go... hot sex...Versailles'.   

@reesieD wrote: 'I realised watching my beloved #Versailles gave me saucy dreams.' 

Another added a rather more graphic observation, saying: '#Versailles: the king was either erect or he had a big willy.'

At least the show is consistent; the second season included 30 X-rated scenes over ten episodes with many calling it the raunchiest series to appear on the BBC.

While there was plenty of admiration for the latest lavish production - the show is estimated to have cost £21million to make, it's likely to be the final series, as French cable channel Canal Plus has reportedly decided to axe the show. 

Speaking to The Sun, a source said: 'The BBC made a big decision when it bought Versailles from Canal Plus, particularly with all the full-frontal nudity.

'At first, viewers were open to all the pornographic scenes but slowly the BBC saw Versailles ratings drop to just one million viewers — and it seems to have had the same effect in France too.

'They believe it will have run its course after the third series, which will see Louis XIV achieve absolute power, so they have decided there won't be a series four,' they concluded.  

Versailles is currently showing on Monday nights on BBC2
item.dc:abstract: Who needs Love Island? The latest series of Versailles aired on BBC2 last night and left plenty of those watching it blushing with its candle-lit regal romps in the court of Louis XIV. While the French series looks likely to be axed after this series, the period drama certainly won't be going quietly if the first episode is anything to go by. (Pictured: Steamy scenes from last night's episode of Versailles. Inset: King Louis XIV, played by George Blagden)
item.dc:creator: Joanna Tweedy
item.mi:shortTitle: Versailles viewers left hot under the collar by raunchiest scenes yet

item.title: Transgender woman who spent £50k on plastic surgery has her navel SEWN UP in ongoing quest to look 'less human' - and more like a Bratz doll
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Jolene Dawson, 21, from Australia's Gold Coast, had her navel 'sewn up' in a $6,000 AUD (£3,420) procedure in a bid to feel 'less human' and 'closer to God'.
item.content:encoded:
A transgender woman who has spent over $98,500 AUD (£56,580) on plastic surgery has had her belly button removed in her ongoing quest to look like a Bratz doll.

Jolene Dawson, 21, from Australia's Gold Coast, had her navel sewn up in a $6,000 AUD (£3,420) procedure, leaving her with a smooth stomach in the latest stage of her transformation.  

Jolene, who was born male but identifies as a woman, has already undergone a breast augmentation, forehead fillers and jaw slimming, and spent three days in hospital recovering from her latest procedure.

Speaking exclusively to MailOnline, Jolene said: 'I got my belly button removed so I could be closer to a Bratz doll and less human.

'I've been very spiritual lately and like the idea of feeling less human and closer to god in that way, like Adam and Eve would be. 

'The surgeon made an incision on either side of my navel and stitched both sides together. My navel is still there under my skin and you can see slight dip where it is. 

'I can have the naval re-opened if I really need to or feel like I want it back.

'I've already started showing of my new stomach in crop tops and mini skirts and I'm happy to report the guy I'm seeing loves it.' 

So far, Jolene has spent more than $98,500 AUD (£56,580) on cosmetic procedures and has kept her penis, but plans to have her Adam's apple removed in the future.

The businesswoman recently told MailOnline how, after hundreds of dates with me, she decided to come out to her parents 'for the third time', this time as a lesbian.

She said: 'I realised I didn't want to be a man, why would I want to be with one?

'I've had some really amazing dates with a lot of older, wealthy men and I'm excited to start dating women now. I'm glad I've kept my penis now, that really helps.'

Jolene added: 'This is the third time I've had to come out to my family, first as a gay boy, then as a trans woman and now as a lesbian.

'I've officially changed my Tinder settings to [looking for] women. I think it's important for people to know that these changes happen and to embrace them.'

And while Jolene admits her physical appearance attracts a lot of passing glances, she insists pays no heed to unwanted attention or cruel comments.

'I've always been really confident,' she said. 'If somebody doesn’t like me, it’s more a missed opportunity for them.'

Jolene has a strict policy of being '100 per cent open' with potential romantic partners, saying: 'If you're going home with me, you're going home with all of me.

'And if you don't want all of me, then I don't want all of you.'

Jolene's $98,500 AUD surgery bill 

. Nose jobs x 4: $8,000 (£4,794)

. Boob job: $12,000 (£7,131)

. Upper facelift: $9,000 (£5,348)

. Mid facelift: $9,000 (£5,348)

. Ears pinned back: $7,500 (£4,457)

. Butt implants: $15,000 (£891)

. Butt implants removed: $4,000 (£2,377)

. Jaw slimming and chin augmentation: $12,000 (£7,131)

. Lip lift: $4,000 (£2,377)

. Fillers and Botox: $9,000 (£5,348)

. Laser hair removal (full body): $3,000 (£1,783)

. Navel removal: $6,000 (£3,420) 

TOTAL: $98,500 AUD (£56,580)
item.dc:abstract: EXCLUSIVE: Jolene Dawson, 21, from Australia's Gold Coast, had her navel 'sewn up' (top right, before and bottom right, after) in a $6,000 AUD (£3,420) procedure in a bid to feel 'less human' and 'closer to God', she told MailOnline. So far, Jolene has spent more than $98,500 AUD (£56,580) on cosmetic procedures and has kept her penis, but plans to have her Adam's apple removed in the future.
item.dc:creator: Unity Blott

item.title: The life of an oligarch princess: Roman Abramovich’s 23-year-old daughter Sofia continues her VERY glamorous London lifestyle with horses, champagne and lavish holidays abroad despite father's war with the British government
item.description: Sofia Abramovich, 23, who is based in London, recently celebrated completing her degree from Royal Holloway at a graduation ball, donning a daring black dress for the occasion.
item.content:encoded:
Her father may have run into issues with his British visa, but Roman Abramovich's daughter Sofia doesn't appear to have any concerns as she continues her glamorous lifestyle in London.

Sofia, 23, recently celebrated completing her management degree from Royal Holloway at a graduation ball, donning a daring black dress featuring a thigh-high split for the occasion.

The student partied until the early hours, describing on her Instagram account how she ended the celebrations by 'crying to what I think was Mr Brightside'.

Sofia - one of the oligarch's seven children - regularly shares envy-inducing snaps on social media, which reflect her love of horses, champagne and exotic holidays.

The student is the third child of Chelsea billionaire owner Abramovich and his second wife Irina, and moved from Russia - where she was born - to England with the rest of her family in 2003.

She is believed to be a Russian citizen and has represented the country in showjumping competitions in the past, but her current British visa status is unclear.  

Sofia, who grew up at her family's £18million estate in Sussex, and along with her older siblings Anna, 26, and Arkadiy, 24, attended private schools in London charging up to £40,000 a year. 

Demonstrating their lavish lifestyle, Anna has previously described how they used to arrive at school by helicopter from their country home in Sussex. 

After starting university,  Sofia was said to have been chaffeur-driven in a bullet-proof Range Rover to Royal Holloway in Egham, Surrey, from London, where she has the choice of two mansions in Belgravia.

The student regularly shares snaps of her luxurious holidays on Instagram, enjoying trips to Ibiza, the Maldives and Tokyo. 

Sofia appears to have formed a strong group of female friends, often sharing group snaps of them together on holiday.

It seems that for father Roman, who is worth £8.7billion, no expense is spared when it comes to his daughter. 

For her 18th birthday, he treated her to lavish birthday bash at the Under The Bridge nightclub at Chelsea’s Stamford Bridge ground, featuring performances from Scouting For Girls and McBusted. 

The party, attended by 500 friends, is believed to have cost the Chelsea owner around £30,000.

Although she's clearly used to living the high-life, Sofia is not afraid to get dirty, and regularly shares pictures of herself at the stables with her beloved horses, Dora, Billy Fraulein and Zanzibar. 

She's completed in competitions around the world, including the Mediterranean Equestrian Tour in Spain and events in Monaco.

Her father is believed to have paid more than three times the market price for one of her horses- an estimated £500,000 - after it won first prize in its class at the International Horse Show at Olympia.

Sofia often shares pictures taken at home with her dogs, Zeke and Blue - as well as throwback images with her parents and siblings. 

ROMAN ABRAMOVICH'S BRITISH VISA ISSUES  

Chelsea FC owner Roman Abramovich has faced a delay in the renewal of his British visa, amid calls for the government to clamp down on Russian 'dirty money' flowing through London.

The billionaire, 51, has already waited six months for the paperwork for his Tier One investors visa to be done, despite the process usually taking only three weeks. 

Abramovich has now become an Israeli citizen, which allows him to visit Britain for up to six months under a waiver scheme. 

However, under the rules, Israeli visitors are not allowed to work or live in Britain. 

Last week there were reports he had withdrawn his application for a UK visa.

Last month, Abramovich denied that the government had demanded him explain the origin of his wealth as part of his visa renewal application.

A source close to the oligarch, who has not been seen in the UK since early April, insisted his finances were not being inspected and the visa renewal was simply taking longer than usual.
item.dc:abstract: Sofia Abramovich, 23, (far left on a yacht in Ibiza and inset left with her father Roman), who is based in London, recently celebrated completing her degree at Royal Holloway at a graduation ball (second left), donning a daring black dress for the occasion. The oligarch's daughter regularly shares snaps of her envy-inducing lifestyle, which includes a recent trip to Tokyo (second from right), celebrating at Notting Hill Carnival (far right) and quaffing champagne (inset right).
item.dc:creator: Emily Chan
item.mi:shortTitle: Inside the glamorous lifestyle of Roman Abramovich’s daughter Sofia

item.title: Did Kate actually wear a NEW outfit to the royal wedding? Eagle-eyed fan claims the duchess DIDN'T recycle her Alexander McQueen coat - and it's all down to a subtle difference in the sleeves
item.description: An Italian royal watcher noted that the Alexander McQueen coat Kate, 36, wore to the wedding had three buttons on its sleeves, while the one she had worn previously has none.
item.content:encoded:
The Duchess of Cambridge won widespread praise for her royal wedding look - widely believed to have been a McQueen coat she has previously worn on three high profile occasions.

However one royal watcher has claimed Kate - frequently praised for recycling her outfits at public engagements - was not wearing coat we had already seen her in the past, but a very similar lookalike.

Eagle-eyed Instagram user Jessica, who runs the account Royal Addicted 2, pointed out there was one subtle but important different between the old and new coat. 

She noted that while the coat Kate, 36, wore to the wedding had three buttons on its sleeves, the one she wore to Princess Charlotte's Christening - as well as other engagements - did not. 

The wedding coat was also a 'primrose yellow', rather than the cream-colour of her original McQueen number. 

While the subtle yellow hue is difficult to see in some of the images from the royal wedding, it is more obvious in photos where she is standing next to Charlotte, three, who was dressed in white, and in the official portraits released by Kensington Palace.

The Instagram user, who regularly posts about royal wardrobes, added that it would not be the first time Kate had bought or commissioned the same piece in two different colours.

The duchess also owns a Preen cocktail dress in red and black; an Emilia Wickstead dress in pink and blue and the same dress by favourite designer Amanda Wakeley in cream and grey.

The original McQueen coat, which features the same cut and flattering neckline as the royal wedding look, was previously worn by Kate to Princess Charlotte's Christening in 2015. 

For the occasion, the duchess styled the coat with a white hat. 

The royal wore the piece a year later to Trooping the Colour in June 2016, pairing it with a pink hat.

She was seen most recently wearing it at the Passchendaele commemoration service during a visit to Belgium back in July last year.
item.dc:abstract: The Duchess of Cambridge won widespread praise for her royal wedding look (right) - believed to have been a McQueen coat she had previously worn on three high profile occasions. However one royal watcher has claimed it was actually not the same coat, but a virtually identical lookalike. Eagle-eyed Instagram user Jessica, who runs the account Royal Addicted 2, pointed out that while the coat Kate, 36, wore to the wedding had three buttons on its sleeves (top right), the one she wore to Princess Charlotte's Christening (left and top left) - as well as other engagements - has none.
item.dc:creator: Kerry Mcdermott
item.mi:shortTitle: Did Kate actually wear a NEW outfit to the royal wedding?

item.title: Simple airport hack to make sure your suitcase arrives early at baggage claim
item.description: There's nothing worse than being stuck at the carousel as other passengers saunter off with their luggage. Savvy travellers have revealed there are a few tips to speed things up.
item.content:encoded:
Waiting at the airport baggage carousel for your luggage to arrive can be one of the most frustrating experiences for impatient travellers.

Luckily, savvy passengers have revealed a few tricks you can use to ensure your luggage arrives first - and you won't have to pay a cent.

One of the hacks to ensure you're not wasting time at baggage claim is to simply label your luggage 'fragile'.

According to Travel+Leisure, all you need to do is ask an airline representative for a 'fragile' sticker when you're checking in your luggage.

It means the luggage will be typically loaded into the aircraft last, and therefore, come out first.

Another hack to help bump long luggage arrival wait times is to check in last.

It will mean your luggage is loaded on to the an aircraft last and will likely be unloaded first.

And if you're on the hunt for other ways to make sure you avoid paying excess baggage fees, you'll be pleased to know there's a way around this too.

Travel website, Skyscanner revealed one of the easiest ways to help keep costs down is to always pay for extra luggage ahead of travelling. 

'You can usually buy by the kilo, or by piece when you book your flight or add it on to your ticket right up to the day you fly,' the website says.

Another tip to make sure you don't get stung with excess baggage costs is to always weigh baggage as you pack so you don't go over your weight limit.

'Balancing a suitcase on bathroom scales can be tricky, but portable luggage scales are fairly cheap and easy to come by - and this way, you can pack your very own weight monitor for the return journey, too,' the experts say.
item.dc:abstract: There's nothing worse than being stuck at the airport after your flight has arrived waiting for your luggage at baggage claim (stock image, top right, bottom right). Savvy travellers have revealed there are a few things you can do to speed things up - and you won't have to pay a cent. Other top travel tips include how to avoid paying excess baggage fees (stock image, left).

item.title: 'Deadly manure gases possible!' Tourists share the VERY alarming road signs they've spotted around the world (and they might be enough to put you off your next adventure)
item.description: People from around the world have been sharing snaps of the bizarre - and occasionally downright scary - notices on a Reddit thread, and comparing stories of where they had been spotted.
item.content:encoded:
From unexploded bombs to deadly gases, these road signs warn travellers against some rather terrifying potential dangers.

People from around the world shared snaps of the bizarre - and truly scary - notices on a Reddit thread, comparing stories of where they had been spotted. 

One poster was left shocked by a signpost at the entry to a forest which reminded them that they were 'no longer top of the food chain' as they were entering bear country. Another stark warning stated simply: 'Propellers chop off heads'.

Others serve as a grim reminder of the lasting impact of landmines.  

Here, FEMAIL rounds up some of the most startling examples...
item.dc:abstract: People from around the world have been sharing snaps of the bizarre - and occasionally downright scary - notices on a Reddit thread, and comparing stories of where they had been spotted. Pictured clockwise from top left: a warning over landmines; a reminder of the dangers of propellers; the Grim Reaper blocks the entrance to a cave: a notice before entering bear country; an area impacted by 'deadly manure gasses'; an abandoned mine is not a place to explore.

item.title: Would you pay $26.90 for a sandwich? Incredible ONE-KILO 'Jurassic Porkwich' sub launches - and customers are going mad for the heart attack on a bun
item.description: A burger bar has just launched a sub that's so jam-packed with pork it 'barely fits in your mouth.' The Jurassic Pork weighs just over a kilo and costs $26.90. Naturally, social media has gone wild.
item.content:encoded:
A Melbourne burger bar has launched a pork-packed sub that's so big, its makers say it 'barely fits in your mouth'.

The Jurassic Porkwich - created by Third Wave Cafe in Port Melbourne - weighs over a kilogram and comes with all varieties of cooked pork, including everyone's favourite - crackling.

'We're talking a big slab of pork belly, pulled pork, bacon, crushed pork crackling with a pork crackling shard on top,' they said. 

The tasty treat, which costs $26.90, is so large that two hands are needed to lift it off the plate.

The sub features pork belly with cheese, slow smoked pulled pork, crispy bacon rashers, BBQ sauce and a layer of crushed pork crackling, all sandwiched between two large house-made sesame-seed buns.

Naturally social media has gone wild for the scrumptious sub, with the video alone clocking up over 17,000 views

Plenty have left comments too with many saying how keen they were to try the pork-packed sandwich.

One man, Tom wrote: 'I'm coming to Melbourne just for this'.

While another, Todd, chimed in with: 'I need this in my life'.

While a third, Mark stated: 'This is my cheat meal for June'.

The burger is available at the Melbourne-based eatery throughout June.
item.dc:abstract: A Melbourne burger bar has just launched a pork-packed sub that's so big, its makers say it 'barely fits in your mouth.' (left and right). The Jurassic Pork weighs over a kilogram and features pork belly with cheese, slow smoked pulled pork, crispy bacon rashers, BBQ sauce, a layer of crushed pork crackling all sandwiched between two large house-made sesame seed buns.
item.dc:creator: Laura House

item.title: 'Look closely': Biomedical student and model, 24, gets trolled online after pointing out her tiny scar in a bikini photo - so can you spot it?
item.description: Gabrielle Epstein, who has a degree in biomedicine and is now a full-time model, shared a raw image to her Instagram in a bid to connect with some of her 1.7 million followers.
item.content:encoded:
More so than ever Instagram influencers are 'getting real' online and taking their fans behind the cloak of filters, Facetuning and free trips to show how normal they really are.

Gabrielle Epstein, who has a degree in biomedicine and is now a full-time model, shared one of those raw images to her Instagram in a bid to connect with some of her 1.7 million followers.

Her caption, which accompanied a seductive bikini photo, read 'if you look closely you can see my scar on the top left of my leg'.

But it didn't have the desired effect she was hoping for, with commenters complaining her 'imperfection' was almost too small to see.

So can you see it?

'Unfollowing just before of the caption,' one person wrote, garnering 70 other 'likes'. 

Another went so far as to imply Gabrielle didn't have any intelligence about her, commenting 'if you look even closer you can see how my brain doesn't work as it should... who else has a plastic brain?'

The 24-year-old Queenslander replied to the thread by suggesting she wouldn't miss them if they unfollowed her.

Others took the post rather well, recounting some of their own scar-related stories and how they ended up with odd shapes on their bodies.

'We all have scars and stretch marks, they make us human and beautiful,' one woman wrote.

'I have a heart shape on my right thigh. Some people wear their heart on their sleeve. I wear mine on my thigh,' another added.

Two days after the controversy Gabrielle changed her caption to simply read: 'Morning.'  

She is currently visiting Byron Bay after a whirlwind trip to the Bahamas, Mexico and California for the annual Coachella festival.
item.dc:abstract: Gabrielle Epstein (pictured), who has a degree in biomedicine and is now a full-time model, shared a raw image (left) to her Instagram in a bid to connect with some of her 1.7 million followers. But it didn't have the desired effect she was hoping for, with commenters complaining her 'imperfection' was almost too small to see.
item.dc:creator: Matilda Rudd
item.mi:shortTitle: Model is savagely trolled online after raunchy post pointing out scar

item.title: 'You should name your next child Choking': Mother whose son, 3, choked to death on a bouncy ball reveals the grieving family are being taunted by heartless trolls
item.description: Mother Anna Davis, from Tasmania, whose three-year-old son Alby choked to death on a bouncy ball has revealed how the grieving family are relentlessly taunted by cruel trolls.
item.content:encoded:
The mother of a three-year-old boy who choked to death on a bouncy ball has revealed how the grieving family are relentlessly taunted by cruel trolls.

Anna Davis, from Tasmania, frantically tried to resuscitate her son Alby for 16 minutes until paramedics arrived - but he died just a week before his fourth birthday.

Taking to Instagram, the mother, who's currently 39 weeks pregnant, shared one of the vicious remarks she faces on a daily basis since her toddler's tragic death in March.

The heartless troll sent a private message to the woman, suggesting: 'You should name your next child Choking' before adding a laughing emoji.

She explained the family have been ignoring most of the nasty comments, but this one in particular struck a chord with her.

'I can't even begin to fathom the sadness and hurt this person much have experienced in their lifetime, to feel the desire to intensify our family's heart ache for the sale of their own amusement,' Ms Davis said.

'Trolling comments and DM's are now part of our daily lives, and I can usually dig deep, and find the strength to move on from such hatred, but this one impacted me deeply, and many more tears than usual have fallen today.'

The mother decided to share the cruel message on her Instagram story - but kept the troll anonymous. 

'I've kept you anonymous so as not to give you more of the attention you so obviously crave,' she wrote.

'I wish you nothing but love and happiness from here on out, in the hopes that no other grieving family may experience your bitterness.'

Earlier this year, little Alby tragically died after he choked on the small ball, the size of a slightly larger 50 cent piece, at his family home.
item.dc:abstract: The mother of a three-year-old boy who choked to death on a bouncy ball has revealed how the grieving family are relentlessly taunted by cruel trolls. Anna Davis, from Tasmania, frantically tried to resuscitate her son Alby for 16 minutes until paramedics arrived - but he died just a week before his fourth birthday. Taking to Instagram, the mother, who's currently 39 weeks pregnant, shared one of the vicious remarks she faces on a daily basis since her toddler's tragic death in March.
item.dc:creator: Cindy Tran
item.mi:shortTitle: Mum whose son choked to death on ball reveals cruel remarks by trolls

item.title: Can you spot why this Caesar salad is the talk of the Internet? Thanks to a chef's incredible talent, the amazing dish is not what it seems
item.description: New York-based George Takei, who has more than 10 million subscribers on Facebook, was enthralled by the salad and commented it was the kind he'd like to eat.
item.content:encoded:
American actor George Takei recently posted a video of what looked to be a plain old Caesar salad - a video that has since taken the Internet by storm.  

The former Star Trek star, who has more than 10 million subscribers on Facebook, was enthralled by the footage and said it was the kind of salad he'd like to eat.

And it's not surprising, with the dish very different from your everyday salad.

In fact it's not a salad at all, it's a cake.

The offering has been brought to the Internet by Otchcakes, who specialises in making life-like treats shaped like Starbucks coffees, raw mince and even a packet of romaine lettuce.

'My nine-year-old son said: "That's how you get people to not eat your food",' one commenter wrote after it was revealed to be a cake. 

But it's not very easy to make in the kitchen as Jennifer from How To Cake That discovered.

To bring the cake to life, the clever baker used real lettuce leaves to mould fake ones using food colouring, vodka and wafer paper.

She then used fondant, again coloured with moss-green food colouring, to coat around a plain vanilla cake with buttercream before placing it inside a real bowl.

This gave the grand illusion of greenery needed to look like the majority of the salad.

To complete the creation she used a cut-up frozen cupcake to make 'croutons' and grated ivory-dyed fondant to make the 'Parmesan cheese' on top.

For the avid bakers, How To Cake That has also shared recipes for an edible lava lamp cake and an eye-popping Adidas sneaker cake.
item.dc:abstract: American actor George Takei recently posted a video of what looked to be a plain old Caesar salad - a video that has since taken the Internet by storm. The former Star Trek star, who has more than 10 million subscribers on Facebook , was enthralled by the footage and said it was the kind of salad he'd like to eat. Except in this case there was one thing that separated the salad from all of the rest.
item.dc:creator: Laura House
item.mi:shortTitle: Bizarre reason plain old Caesar salad is the talk of the Internet

item.title: Mother-of-three posts snaps from her daughter's ingenious $500 Kmart birthday slumber party - but mums are going crazy for something else in the photos
item.description: With the help of Kmart Kaysand Whitehurst, from NSW, has managed to set herself up with an incredible sleepover she'll be using for her daughters in years to come.
item.content:encoded:
Trying to come up with a new and ingenious idea for your child's birthday party can be tedious.

But with the help of Kmart, Kaysand Whitehurst set herself up with an incredible sleepover extravaganza she'll be using for her daughters in years to come.

The NSW-based mother-of-three purchased 10 airbeds, pillows, fitted sheets, blankets and tents to curate the ultimate birthday for $500.

The tents, which cost $20 each, come in a grey colour so Kaysand bought 30m of purple cotton fabric from Spotlight to make the 'walls' of the tepees.

She'll use the grey colour again for her son's birthday.

'The tents disassemble and are very compact. The grey didn't suit my girly girl at all. I made another set of covers, my other daughter wants black so I'll keep my eye out for another 40 per cent off sale at Spotlight,' she said. 

'This is my three kids parties done for the next few years I just need to maintain and add food, games and a cake.' 

She was particularly impressed with the $8 airbeds, which she blew up with a vacuum the day before and 'were spot on' by the night of the party. 

The fairy lights, which were 'randomly on sale from $8 down to $2', made the perfect addition come evening time.

'I just wish they had more at the time,' she said.

While fellow mothers on Facebook praised Kaysand for even throwing a sleepover with 10 young girls, she said it was easier than it seemed.   

'Depending on the personalities having more kids is easier then just a few,' she said.

'The girls that were here were amazing and pretty much entertained themselves.'

At first inspection the $500 price may seem a tad steep, but when you consider the cost of your average party at an ice-skating rink, movies or bowling alley - Kaysand said it was a 'good investment'.

'I just need to make sure we use it. I have another four slumber parties planned in the next two months so I reckon I will,' the clever mother said.

And while photos of the sweet evening attracted high praise from other mothers in the Kmart Mums Australia group - many were distracted by the view.

'Does the house come with the slumber party?' One person wrote, while another asked where she lived to attract scenery like that.

'The Hawkesbury River. It's an hour out of Sydney and absolute bliss,' Kaysand replied.
item.dc:abstract: With the help of Kmart Kaysand Whitehurst has managed to set herself up with an incredible sleepover she'll be using for her daughters in years to come (pictured). The NSW-based mother-of-three purchased ten airbeds, pillows, fitted sheets, blankets and tents to curate the ultimate birthday for $500. The tents, which cost $20 individually, come in a grey colour so Kaysand bought 30 metres of purple cotton fabric from Spotlight to make as the 'walls' of the tepees. She'll use the grey colourway again for her son's birthday.

item.title: The miracle product personal trainer and model Camilla Akerberg, 28, swears by for fat loss, good gut health and stabilised blood sugar - and it costs just $6
item.description: Australian fitness professional Akerberg, 28, attributes much of her svelte physique and glowing complexion to a cult product fast becoming the king of all superfoods.
item.content:encoded:
Certified personal trainer and performance nutrition coach, Camilla Akerberg, is letting fans in on the secret to her killer body - and it's not just her rigorous gym workouts.

The Australian fitness professional attributes much of her svelte physique and glowing complexion to a cult product that is fast becoming the king of all superfoods: apple cider vinegar (ACV).

Starting her day the right way, Camilla, 28, rises early and gets her digestive juices flowing with a large glass of water, squeezed lemon and one tablespoon of ACV. 

Apple cider vinegar has been a multi-purpose health saviour among those in the know for centuries.

Made by steeping chopped apples in water and leaving the concoction at room temperature, naturally occurring sugars in the apples eventually ferment to form the component acetic acid as well as many health-promoting enzymes. 

Nutritionists the world over recommend opting for an unfiltered, organic brand of the product, such as Bragg's apple cider vinegar which is available at Woolworths stores for just $6.

The benefits that go hand-in-hand with regular apple cider vinegar consumption are staggering.

'The positives are quite extensive - if you are not already, you should make it part of your daily routine', Ms Akerberg advises.

This wonder product is especially attractive to diabetics, as Camilla notes that it has been proven to improve insulin sensitivity, stabilise blood sugar levels within a healthy range and and aid the prevention of chronic conditions associated with the ageing process.

Ms Akerberg also explains how drinking just a tablespoon a day of ACV can keep our cardiac and circulatory systems in check. 

Several animal studies have shown a link between ACV, lower cholesterol and optimum blood pressure, which Camilla says could lead to a reduced risk of heart disease.

And for those looking to shed stubborn kilograms, apple cider vinegar could be your new best friend.

'Numerous research studies show that vinegar can increase satiety and therefore help you eat fewer calories which leads to fat loss', Ms Akerberg explains. She suggests taking ACV with carb-heavy meals to help you feel fuller for longer.

Ms Akerberg highlights the benefits which ACV has been demonstrated to have on leaky gut syndrome, an often misdiagnosed condition which is the cause of many serious health problems and widely regarded as a warning sign for many autoimmune diseases.

If all of this still leaves you unconvinced, the far reaching benefits of taking apple cider vinegar even stretch to cancer prevention and treatment. 

Ms Akerberg says that numerous animal studies have confirmed that ACV shrinks cancer cells, and even kill tumors in certain cases.

Common daily uses of the star product also include disinfecting cuts and scars, alleviating warts and soothing painful ear infections.

In addition to incorporating apple cider vinegar into your daily diet plan for a healthier you, Ms Akerberg advocates increasing fibre intake.

She also recommends snacking only on fresh, whole foods or low-calorie, low-GI alternatives and ensuring that you get enough sleep at night to keep those nagging cravings for junk food at bay.

She also suggests taking Vitamin B supplements alongside your ACV drink every morning in order to decrease the desire for sugar.
item.dc:abstract: Certified personal trainer and performance nutrition coach Camilla Akerberg (pictured) is letting fans in on the secret to her killer body - and it's not just her rigorous gym workouts. Australian fitness professional Akerberg, 28, attributes much of her svelte physique and glowing complexion to a cult product that is fast becoming the king of all superfoods. So what is it?

item.title: Will self-proclaimed feminist Meghan change the law to allow for a female heir? Duke and Duchess of Sussex's future daughters cannot inherit titles because current legislation only allows dukedoms to pass to men
item.description: Only a male heir can inherit the dukedom - so when Prince Harry died, the title Duke of Sussex will go on to his son, regardless of whether the son is his first-born.
item.content:encoded:
Meghan Markle may not be entirely happy about her new title — or at least, what it means for her future children.

When she and Prince Harry said 'I do' last month, the queen named them the Duke and Duchess of Sussex.

But Meghan, 36, a self-described feminist, may have been upset to learn that when it comes to titles, men and women are not treated equally under the law — and if the couple's first-born child is a daughter, she'll have no claim to the same title as her mother.

As People points out, inheritance of titles doesn't work the same way as land or money, and dukedom can only be inherited by male children — not female, regardless of birth order.

So if Harry and Meghan — who are rumored to want to start a family right away — welcome a boy as their first child, he will one day inherit his dad's title, Duke of Sussex. 

But if there first child is a girl, she will simply be called 'Lady'. If the couple has a girl first and then a boy, the second child is heir to the dukedom, and their daughter will be skipped over in that regard.

Meghan has spoken out quite a bit about being a feminist and fighting for women to be treated equally to men, so this bit of news about inequality among her future children may not have gone over well. 

There's also a possibility that she may push to change the rule. Whether she'll be successful is anyone's guess, but it wouldn't be the first time that laws of inheritance have changed to treat women more equally.

The Succession to the Crown Act of 2013 officially changed the policy on who could become king or queen. Before, male children took precedence over female children — so new baby Prince Louis would have been higher in the line of succession than his big sister, Princess Charlotte. 

But now birth order is the determining factor, regardless of sex.

Indeed, Charlotte made history when her younger brother was born in April 2018 as the first female royal to retain her position in the line of succession to the throne, regardless of the gender of her younger sibling.    

'Succession to the Crown not to depend on gender: In determining the succession to the Crown, the gender of a person born after 28 October 2011 does not give that person, or that person’s descendants, precedence over any other person (whenever born),' the act declares.

The same act also meant that members of the Royal family who marry a Catholic will no longer be disqualified. 

Interestingly, the act was viewed by many as an important, and necessary, step for the royal family in terms of embracing a more modern way of life, and is certainly one that was praised by many.  

A number of people have called for a similar change to be made to the legislation regarding peerages, with several high profile supporters speaking out in recent years to demand that women be given the opportunity to carry on their family titles.

Certainly, if Meghan did decide to speak up on behalf of any potential future daughter, she find herself with numerous allies willing to support her stance. 

In 2017, Robin Neville, the 10th Baron Braybrooke, passed away. Baron Braybrooke has no sons and seven daughters — and none of them could inherit his title, or the 6,000-acre Essex estate that went along with it.

Instead, the title and home were passed on to a distant cousin. 

At the time, Downton Abbey creator Julian Fellowes condemned the law, which left the late Barron's eldest daughter Amanda Murray with nothing. 

Amanda chimed in too, pointing out fault with the status quo.

'It boils down to this: If I was a boy, I would be sitting pretty,' she told the Telegraph. 'My poor father had no son; just lots of daughters. 

'In this day and age, with supposed equality, why am I not allowed to inherit my father’s estate?' 

Interestingly, when the Duke of Sussex title was first conferred in 1801, it wasn't passed down either. Prince Augustus Frederick was given the title by his father, King George III — but when he died, it temporarily died out too, since his son was the result of a marriage that was later annulled. 

Prince Harry is only the second-ever Duke of Sussex, while Meghan is the first-ever Duchess of Sussex.
item.dc:abstract: When Meghan Markle and Prince Harry said 'I do' last month, the queen named them the Duke and Duchess of Sussex. But dukedom can only be inherited by male children — not female — regardless of birth order. So if Harry and Meghan — who are rumored to want to start a family right away — welcome a boy as their first child, he will one day inherit his dad's title, Duke of Sussex. But if there first child is a girl, she will simply be called 'Lady'. In 2013, the Succession to the Crown Act changed the law regarding succession to the throne so it is based on birth order, regardless of gender. This means that William and Kate's daughter, Princess Charlotte, follows her older brother George in the line of succession to the throne, however that law applies to those in line for the crown, not members of the peerage.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: Prince Harry & Meghan's future daughter won't inherit a title

item.title: Mystery solved! The Backstreet Boys FINALLY explain the confusing lyrics in their 1999 hit I Want It That Way - after a baffled Chrissy Teigen voiced her confusion over the song on Twitter
item.description: The single was released in 1999, and its lyrics have continued to baffle fans. Chrissy Teigen complained about the non-sensical chorus on Twitter, and the band's official Twitter account replied.
item.content:encoded:
For nearly two decades, the Backstreet Boys' hit song I Want It That Way has inspired millions of listeners to sing along — even though most would admit they have no idea what the words they're singing actually mean.

The lyrics to the 1999 single are certainly confusing: What, exactly, is the 'that way' that the boys are referring to? 

But while the boyband has spent nearly 20 years refusing to clear things up, this week they finally offered up an explanation for the words to the song after being prompted by a tweet from Chrissy Teigen

Chrissy complained about the lyrics in a tweet on June 1, which has gone on to earn 56,000 likes.

'"I never wanna hear you say, 'I want it that way' cause i want it that way". He doesn’t wanna hear it because he is the one that wants it that way? He wants to be the one to say it? Also what is “it”?' she wrote.

'It seems they both want it the same way but are fighting over who gets to say they want it that way,' she added.

Hours later, the official Twitter account for the Backstreet Boys responded, offering a breakdown of the lyrics.

'Don’t wanna hear you say that you want heartaches and mistakes... or to be 2 worlds apart,' the account tweeted. 'We don’t want you to want "it" that way - that’s the way we want it... for you to not want it that way.' 

Fans were amazed that Chrissy managed to get a response, when the band had avoided explaining the lyrics for so long.

I Want It That Way chorus lyrics

Tell me why

Ain't nothin' but a heartache

Tell me why

Ain't nothin' but a mistake

Tell me why

I never want to hear you say

I want it that way

'Dear Chrissy, fans and media have been asking for years but YOU...you have gotten it out of them. You should win a Nobel Peace Prize for this (or something like that),' wrote one.

'What kind of voodoo magic does she have that she got the answer?!' wrote another.

While BSB did finally clear up the confusion with the explanation, though, the reasoning they gave may not actually have been the original intent of the lyrics.

In fact, the men have admitted in the past that the words don't actually make any sense. In a 2016 interview with the Huffington Post, several of the band members acknowledged that there was some internal dialogue about the lyrics before the song was released.

Written by hit-maker Max Martin, the song was very catchy — even if the words, strictly speaking, were gibberish.


'Well it’s funny, we actually were OK with the lyrics when we heard it first,' Nick Carter said. 

But the president of JIVE Records, which was releasing their album, noticed that the words didn't add up, and had some A&R people change the lyrics. 

'To make the song make more sense,' Kevin Richardson said.

Producers were hired to redo the song, and BSB even recorded a version with different words 

The Backstreet Boys were releasing the album with JIVE and so the label having a problem with the nonsense lyrics could have derailed the single.

According to LA Weekly, part of the new song went: 'No goodbyes (ain't nothing but a heartache) / No more lies (ain't nothing but a mistake) / That is why / I love it when I hear you say, / "I want it that way."'

However, when BSB heard the new version, they decided it didn't have the same ring as the original, messed-up lyrics and all.

'So, there was another version of the song out there and then we listened to it back. Then, we as a group voted on it and said, "No,"' Carter said.

So how did the nonsensical lyrics make it to recording in the first place? Max Martin was responsible for a long list of hits — including Britney Spear's Hit Me Baby One More Time (which also has some strange lyrics).

But Martin, who is Swedish, didn't have a great grasp on English — hence lyrics that didn't make sense.

Martin also wrote NSYNC's Tearin' Up My Heart, Robyn's Show Me Love, Kelly Clarkson's Since U Been Gone, Katy Perry's Hot 'N Cold, and Taylor Swift's I Knew You Were Trouble.
item.dc:abstract: The hit single was released in 1999, and its lyrics have continued to baffle fans. Chrissy Teigen complained about the nonsensical chorus on Twitter, and the band's official Twitter account replied. They explained that they 'never want to hear you say' that you want heartaches and mistakes. The explanation may have just been made up, as several of the band members admitted in the past that the lyrics are gibberish. They were written by Swedish songwriter and producer Max Martin, whose English wasn't good at the time of writing it in the late 90s.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: The Backstreet Boys FINALLY explain the lyrics in I Want It That Way

item.title: Her Majesty’s new right hand woman! Newlywed Meghan will accompany the Queen on a whirlwind day of engagements in Chester next week – in her first royal outing WITHOUT Harry
item.description: The new Duchess of Sussex, 36, will be joining the 92-year-old monarch to open the Storyhouse Theatre and attend a lunch in Chester next Thursday. They will also open the Mersey Gateway Bridge.
item.content:encoded:
Meghan will be looking to get tips from the Queen as she prepares to conduct her first joint engagement with Her Majesty in Chester.

The new Duchess of Sussex, 36, will be joining the 92-year-old monarch to open the Storyhouse Theatre and attend a lunch in the city next Thursday.

The pair will also open the Mersey Gateway Bridge in Widnes, Cheshire, on the same day. 

This is expected to be Meghan's first official engagement without Harry, and among her first appearances following their honeymoon.

Harry and Meghan have not been seen in public since Prince Charles' 70th birthday celebrations at Buckingham Palace last month, just three days after their wedding.  

However, the Duke and Duchess of Sussex are expected to appear on the Buckingham Palace balcony with the rest of the royal family during the Trooping the Colour parade this Saturday.

The pair are believed to have jetted off on their honeymoon last week, with reports that they have chosen Fairmont Jasper Park Lodge in Canada as their destination. 

According to TMZ, the new Duke and Duchess are staying at the 6,000 sq ft Outlook Cabin which has been dubbed 'The Royal Retreat'. 

Previous royal visitors include King George VI and the Queen Mother, who stayed there in 1939, and Queen Elizabeth and Prince Philip, who visited in June 2005. 

Other famous names who have visited the spot include Anthony Hopkins, John Travolta and Bill Gates. 

It had previously been reported that Harry and Meghan wanted to 'hit the ground running' when it came to their royal duties following the wedding.

Aides are promising that the second half of this year will be ‘incredibly busy’ for Harry and Meghan when it comes to official visits.  

The pair are already scheduled to visit Sydney in October for the Invictus Games. 

The couple are expected to then continue their tour Down Under to include visits to New Zealand, Fiji and Tonga. 

The newlyweds are also expected to undertake a couple of short overseas visits before the start of the summer, including a two-day visit to Dublin.  

However, it appears that Meghan will be learning the ropes from the Queen ahead of overseas visits later in the year.  

While the Duchess of Cambridge joined the Queen on several engagements in 2012 after marrying William, her first official engagements as a member of the royal family were not with the monarch.
item.dc:abstract: The new Duchess of Sussex, 36, will be joining the 92-year-old monarch to open the Storyhouse Theatre and attend a lunch in Chester next Thursday. The pair will also open the Mersey Gateway Bridge in Widnes, Cheshire, on the same day.
item.dc:creator: Emily Chan

item.title: Is Johnny Depp's gaunt appearance down to ditching 'guy-liner'? Expert reveals why the make-up free star, 54, looked 'tired and extremely pale' in snaps that sparked health fears
item.description: Pictures of the veteran actor, 54, meeting fans in Russia last week sparked concerns for his health, but a celebrity make-up artist said his appearance could be largely down to a lack of make-up.
item.content:encoded:
Johnny Depp has sparked concern among fans after 'unrecognisable' snaps showed him looking gaunt and 'ill', however his changed appearance could largely be down to ditching his 'guyliner'. 

The veteran actor, 54, seemed to be make-up free in snaps with fans in Russia that were posted to Instagram last week.

And celebrity make-up artist and owner of Pouts & Pinups Stacey Whittaker told Femail that ditching his signature smokey eye has had a huge impact on Depp's face.

'Usually Johnny Depp has a cool grunge style, however here he is not sporting his signature smudged guy-liner, which makes his eyes appear smaller,' she explained.  

'Dark eyes can look harsh as we get older, but Depp’s normal sultry looking eye would never overpower his face and would actually give him more definition and colour.

'Without his attention-grabbing guy-liner it makes his eyes seem tired and dull, and his skin extremely pale, whereas liner would brighten and bring out the whites of the eye.'

Scroll down for video 

While fans are used to seeing Depp wear heavy make-up for his role as Captain Jack Sparrow in Pirates of the Caribbean, his love of eyeliner extends to his personal life. 

He's regularly seen on the red carpet or at photocalls for his films, wearing a smudge of black kohl on his bottom eyelids.  

Concerns for the Pirates of the Caribbean star arose a few days ago when he posed for two photographs with female fans at the Four Seasons hotel in St. Petersburg before a performance with his band, The Hollywood Vampires.

The women shared them excitedly on social media afterwards, sparking comments over Depp's appearance.

'I think that my hero looks ill,' said one concerned admirer on Facebook, while another added that he 'looks thin'. 

'Others did not seem to recognize the Pirates of the Caribbean star at all. 

'F*** me is that Johnny Depp?' remarked one Twitter user. 

His European tour with the band comes as his seemingly endless legal woes continue. 

Depp has been embroiled in a legal dispute with his former management company for months. 

He claims they mismanaged his millions and left him vulnerable, a claim they insist is not true.

He is also being sued by former bodyguards who claimed that he forced them to work in a toxic environment at his home and that they sometimes had to act as a babysitter for the star. 

Some of the men worked for him during his marriage to Amber Heard which ended in astonishing acrimony and accusations of alcoholism, drug addiction and domestic abuse.

Depp denied her claims of physical abuse and his daughter and ex-partner Vanessa Paradis spoke out to defend him, insisting it was not true.  

Heard was given a $7million divorce settlement after they parted ways. She donated it to charity.
item.dc:abstract: Pictures of the veteran actor, 54, meeting fans in Russia last week sparked concerns for his health, with commenters noting that he looked thin and ill (left). However, a celebrity make-up artist has revealed that his changed appearance could be largely down to ditching his signature eye-liner (seen right in 2016).
item.dc:creator: Siofra Brennan
item.mi:shortTitle: Expert reveals why Johnny Depp looked 'tired and extremely pale'

item.title: Married again! Prince Frederik's 50th birthday celebrations doubled as a 'second wedding' - and the royal couple plan to officially renew their vows later this year
item.description: It was an action-packed week of celebrations that included gala dinners and events. But according to Royal insiders, Crown Prince Frederik's 50th birthday also doubled up as a second wedding.
item.content:encoded:
It was an action-packed week of celebrations that included gala dinners, red carpet events and the release of official portraits.

But according to Royal insiders, Crown Prince Frederik's 50th birthday celebrations last week also doubled up as a second wedding for the happy couple.

Speaking to New Idea, the anonymous palace source said: 'It might have been his birthday, but for Fred and Mary and their four children they saw it as a chance to get married all over again.' 

'Fred and Mary have always talked about renewing their vows and made the decision last week to finally take the plunge,' they added. 

While the source also said that the couple 'plan to renew their vows officially during a private holiday later in the year, probably during the European summer - [but] they decided to make Fred's 50th birthday celebration a night to remember and treat is as their second wedding'.  

Princess Mary wasn't, they continued, scheduled to speak on the night of the gala.

Nevertheless, she broke protocol at the last minute in order to deliver a speech to her 'darling' husband.

The couple later took to the dance floor for their 'first dance', delighting guests and friends and family. 

The Crown Princess's speech began with a detailed list of Prince Frederik's most admirable personality traits.

She explained the father of four has an ability to put other people at ease, be a successful leader and promote equality while being a kind of considerate father.

'I am so happy you swept me off my feet and that we dared to fall for each other not just for a moment but for life,' she said lovingly.

Before long, she forayed into witty banter, suggesting he laughs loudly and often at his own jokes and was a chronic 'MAMIL', the popular acronym for a middle-aged man in lycra.

'MAMIL stands for a middle-aged man in lycra who rides expensive racing bicycles wearing professional style body-hugging jerseys and shorts,' she said.

'Opinions vary over whether lycra and men in their 40s go together. But darling, you still look rather sharp in lycra.' 

The 46-year-old royal made mention that the first time she saw him change from shorts and a T-shirt to his gala uniform she thought: 'I've really scored above my league.'

As the Crown Princess made mention of his children's love for him, Frederik wiped a tear from his eye.  

Elsewhere in the week-long 50th birthday celebration, the Danish royal family enjoyed a live broadcast of the TV show 'All of Denmark celebrates the Crown Prince'.  

For the momentous occasion, Princess Mary opted for a brightly-coloured patterned kimono-style dress, which she wore with strappy heels and loose curls.

The Danish royals' children were also neatly dressed and wore huge smiles on the red carpet.

Princess Josephine, in particular, drew attentions for her adorable pink ballet skirt and slippers. 

A new official photograph by photographer Franne Voigt has also been released to mark the event.
item.dc:abstract: It was an action-packed week of celebrations that included gala dinners, red carpet events and the release of official portraits. But according to Royal insiders, Crown Prince Frederik's 50th birthday celebrations last week (left and right) also doubled up as a second wedding for the happy couple. Speaking to New Idea, the anonymous palace source said: 'It might have been his birthday, but for Fred and Mary and their four children they saw it as a chance to get married all over again.'
item.dc:creator: Sophie Haslett
item.mi:shortTitle: Prince Frederik and Princess Mary enjoy second wedding

item.title: 'She will have to fight for it!' Australian grandmother, 47, hits back at plastic surgery loving English nanna, 36, saying she 'regrets' her own boob job - as the two battle it out for the 'Granny Ashes'
item.description: Gina Stewart (pictured), 47, rose to prominence after taking out the Miss Maxim Australia title earlier this year, with her looks and the fact she was a grandmother leading to international headlines.
item.content:encoded:
An Australian bikini model dubbed the 'world's hottest grandma' says an English nanna also claiming the crown 'is going to have to fight for it'.

Gina Stewart, 47, rose to prominence after taking out the Miss Maxim Australia title earlier this year, with her looks and the fact she was a grandmother leading to international headlines.

But her unofficial title as the 'world's hottest nanna' was challenged over the weekend by British kickboxer Carrie Hilton, 36, who boasted to Daily Mail Australia: 'I'm the hottest... there is no competition here.'

While she is amused by all the attention the pair have received, Ms Stewart has now hit back, joking with her 'rival' that she won't give up the title easily.

Scroll down for video 

'I've never claimed the title of 'world's hottest grandmother' it was given to me by the world press and fans all over the world,' Ms Stewart said.

'Carrie Hilton is gorgeous and so is every other woman out there. Carrie is welcome to the title but she will have to fight for it!

'I entered Maxims competition in the hope of winning the prize money for my friend Jodi who recently suffered a stroke. Somehow word got out about my age... (and) it started a whole new story.' 

Ms Hilton from Bolton, in north-west England, became a grandmother for the first time earlier this year when her daughter Clarice, 17, gave birth to baby Jessica. 

Just days later the fitness fanatic, who has spent more than AUD$23,000 (£13,000) on cosmetic surgery, became a social media hit when she publicly announced herself as the 'world's hottest nanna'.

Left unimpressed after finding out about Ms Stewart's claims to the title Ms Hilton laid down the gauntlet, claiming there was no doubt she is the better of the pair.

'She (Ms Stewart) looks good for her age, I admit, I'm doubtful that she's not had any work done, in terms of Botox and quite a few beauty treatments,' the Englishwoman told Mail Online.

'I was dubbed "Britain's most glamorous granny" in January and then the "worlds hottest granny" by various media outlets around the world shortly after (Clarice gave birth).

'I'm the hottest granny, there is no competition here.'

While Ms Hilton has spent a small fortune on cosmetic work to aid her appearance, mother-of-four Ms Stewart has only gone under the knife once.

Low on confidence after being bullied as a child, she said the decision to get breast implants is one she now looks back on with regret.

'I grew up self hating from bullying at school and listening to people's judgement on the way I should look,' Ms Stewart said.

'I went under the knife 11 years ago for breast augmentation and I regret it. 

'Knowing what I know now, I wouldn't have had that surgery as it made no difference to my confidence. I was still judged on my breast size.

'I have had no other procedures and I will try to encourage other woman that we are beautiful without all this modern medicine that’s filled with chemicals that we are putting into our perfectly healthy bodies.'

Ms Hilton, who works as a media sales manager, is a black belt in kickboxing and has won six silver medals for the U.K at international level.

While training up to five times a week keeps her fit, she has also had breast implants, teeth bonds, hair extensions, brows and lashes, and Botox to ensure she maintains her youthful appearance.

'When shop assistants and people at the gym hear Clarice saying "Mum" they ask her to repeat herself. Then I tell them I'm a nanny and they go: "No way!",' Ms Hilton told The Sun earlier this year. 

'I've always been fit and active. I don't go out much, all I do is work and train, so I haven't used the fact I'm a grandma to fend off any young men.' 

'I've had lots of messages from admirers. Most of them asking for dates or sex. I've even had some people asking to marry me.'

An advocate for 'ageing gracefully', Ms Stewart last year revealed her skin and beauty secrets.

'I drink alkaline water only, it's got lots of minerals in it as well. Rosehip oil is also my secret weapon, I swear by it, it is anti-ageing,' she said.

'Basically what I do is I cleanse and I put this on my face afterwards – that's my daily routine.'

A Daily Mail Australia poll of close to 2,000 readers asking them to pick the 'world's hottest grandmother' saw Ms Stewart come out on top with 68 per cent of the vote, compared to just 32 per cent for Ms Hilton.

The Aussie beauty is also winning the Instagram battle with more than 75,000 followers dwarfing Ms Hilton, who has just over 12,000, but says that's not what is important to her.

'I think everyone is beautiful. I'm not doing this for attention as I hate it. I'm just trying to make a difference to inspire women not to rip each other apart,' Ms Stewart said.

'Life is too short for judgement. Embrace your age and your curves, it never killed anyone.'

Gina Stewart, 47, rose to prominence after taking out the Miss Maxim Australia title earlier this year, with her looks and the fact she was a grandmother leading to international headlines. But her unofficial title as the 'world's hottest nanna' was challenged over the weekend by British kickboxer Carrie Hilton, 36, who boasted to Daily Mail Australia: 'I'm the hottest... there is no competition here.' While she is amused by all the attention the pair have received, Ms Stewart has now hit back, joking with her 'rival' that she won't give up the title easily.
